utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: I ought to have this framed, my last bill from Princeton.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: And I thought we were celebrating the fact that I actually graduated.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: I always knew you'd be able to graduate, what I didn’t know was whether I would be able to pay for it. Your mom, uh, she’d be so proud of you.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: You always say that.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: I’m so proud of you. Always was.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: Come on dad you going to cry.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: You want to be embarrassed?

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: Look, uh, don’t party too hard tonight, your grandmother wants a picture of you getting that sheepskin, and it’d be nice if you didn’t look completely hung-over.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: Ooh, no, don’t worry, I’ve had enough alcohol in the past week to last me another four years.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: Good. I think.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: You are the man!

utterance.speaker: Taddy
utterance.content: Tell me something I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: Ow! Ow, OW! Hey that’s not funny man.

utterance.speaker: Taddy
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: Yeah right, you shocked me.

utterance.speaker: Taddy
utterance.content: With what? I got nothing.

utterance.speaker: Kid 2
utterance.content: Yo dude, check it out.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: All right whoever’s doing that better cut it out!

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: What the hell's going on?

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Maybe there’s a short somewhere, the floor’s covered with beer.

utterance.speaker: Kid
utterance.content: No the outlets are GFIs, plus he’s got rubber-soled shoes on.

utterance.speaker: Kid
utterance.content: Somebody call 911!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Patient experiences shock-like sensations, as well as headaches, nausea, and drowsiness.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Shocks?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Excruciatingly painful shocks. ER docs referred him to a neurologist, who referred him to five other doctors in the last seven days.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Shocks could be L'Hermitte's Sign, early symptom of MS.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No, MRI showed no white matter lesions, and the shocks aren’t accompanied by neck flexing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good morning!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It’s almost noon.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Really? That must be why I’m so hungry. Who’s up for lunch?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: What’s with the jacket?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It keeps me warm, and cool. How does it know?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: We're discussing your new patient.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Must be a boring discussion, considering that I haven’t accepted a new patient.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You accepted him the moment I loaned you five grand.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, wait, wait, when I said I’d do anything for the money, obviously I didn’t mean it.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You’re going to like this. Kid’s getting shocked every few minutes.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Why would you need five thousand dollars?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Bad night at poker, or great night with a hooker?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thank you for saving me the trouble of deflecting that personal question with a joke. College student? Nitrous oxide is fun at parties. ’Cause the shocks and drinking 'til you puke every night can cause everything else. Give him some B12.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Been there done that, also ruled out cancer, MS, pyridoxine toxicity, and all the popular neuropathies.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cervical spondylosis?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Doesn’t explain the low white count.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He’s black, I’m assuming he’s not just really dirty, but is of African descent. Which means he’d have a lower white count.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Not this low.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He’s a wrestler, probably uses diuretics to cut weight, can also cause low white count.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Not this low.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not this low. Tieshets.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No skin lesions.

utterance.speaker: Hose
utterance.content: Cervical herpes osteomyelitis?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No external outbreak.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Something’s missing. Find out what it is.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Uh, I don’t even know what that means.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well figure it out, find it out, and then find me, I’ll be at lunch.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: No ideas?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Lots of ideas, too many ideas, that’s why so many tests. Have you used any recreational drugs?

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: What? I’m going to get mad at you for getting stoned? Not today. Not here.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: Um, well at Christmas, one of the guys had some Ecstasy. It was... Son of a bitch.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: ANA is negative for lupus, again.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: House wants more information, not the same information done over again.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Find what’s missing. For all we know the kid is dying, and he’s giving us riddles?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Did a more detailed history, went back three generations.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: And?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: His mom died in a car accident, his mom’s mom had arthritis, and his mom’s mom’s dad served in an all black tank battalion in Gapettion.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Fascinating. If it’s not a tumor it has to be MS.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Wilson already ruled out

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: MRI can’t rule out MS 100% of the time.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: MS doesn’t explain the low white count.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Alcoholism does. On admission his BAC was 2.0, liver enzymes off the chart.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It was graduation weekend. He barely drank in the weeks before that and he didn’t drink at all during his wrestling season.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: IF you believe him.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I did a tox screen!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It doesn’t matter if she believes him or not. It’s already in the chart. We’re supposed to find out what’s missing.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Well this, this is perfect.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Invite me to dinner Thursday night. Come on we haven’t had a nice meal together since, oh…

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yesterday when I loaned you five thousand dollars to buy a new car.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: My treat.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Two-wheeled vehicles that travel 150 miles an hour don’t really go well with crippled, irresponsible, drug addicts.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Actually two-wheeled vehicles that go 180 miles an hour do not go well with healthy responsible architects who don’t know how to separate breaking and turning. Good news is, it brings the price right down.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You’re taking it back.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Forget dinner, you’re going to kill yourself!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Nice bike!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thank you. See that’s how you do it, compliments, dinner.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: What do you do with your cane?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If he buys me dinner, he’ll find out. Evel Knievel had the same setup.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: And he broke every bone in his body.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We went though all the imaging studies, and re-did blood cultures.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don’t want hand-me-downs. I want brand new stuff.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Well there’s nothing There’s nothing…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sorry I didn’t catch that last part!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: There’s nothing There's nothing else we can do.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You checked the police report?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: On what?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: On his mom's car accident.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It was 15 years ago, the kid wasn't even in the car

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She veered off a straight dry road in broad daylight. That doesn't seem odd to you?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She probably got distracted changing radio stations or something.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's what the police thought. Of course, they didn't know that she has a family member who is frequently incapacitated by shock-like sensations

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Genetic component seems unlikely

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's interesting. Type 2 neurofibromatosis could cause the shocks.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You knew this was missing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I knew something was missing. Maybe this, maybe something else. Get a DNA analysis of the long arm of chromosome 22

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You'd rather have dinner with your wife?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yes, I would. If she were speaking to me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Unlike her, I could make it worth your while

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Should I drive?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Uhh...no. And I'm not letting you in my car until I see your wallet

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: NF2. It's an inherited disease Could cause abnormal growths in the cranial nerves. It would explain the shocks and other symptoms

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: DNA analysis will show whether your son has the specific chromosome mutation which causes the disease

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: But if it's inherited, that means someone else in our family would have it

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We think your wife may have had it

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: No, she never had any sort of health problems

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: No odd-looking freckles? Nodules in the iris?

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: Nothing. I mean, why would you think she was sick?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We think it may have been what caused her car accident

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: Wait, wait... what do you mean? My mom's car was hit by a drunk driver.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That's not what the police report indicated

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: Well, then you must have gotten the wrong report

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: No. They didn't. When you started driving, I umm...

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: Wha... you lied about how mom died?

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: I figured if her death could somehow mean something to you--

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: How's lying about it mean something?! How could you use her like that, dad? Her death?

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: I was just trying to protect you.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: What else isn't true? She wasn't a teacher? You just wanted me to read?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What's that smell?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I don't smell...

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We're going to need a nurse

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: What the hell?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It's ok, we'll take care of it

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: You didn't feel anything?

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You feel that?

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: Yeah

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: But you didn't feel any of this?

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Sphincter paralysis plus shocks equals Miller Fisher syndrome

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Not if you had the stool sample which was negative for botulinism.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He lied to his son about how his mom died?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He was just protecting him

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Manipulating him.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It's what parents do.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: They lie to us because they love us. Who's getting teary?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Mom's death is irrelevant. DNA revealed no NF2 markers or any other inherited disease. Apparently, she really did fall asleep at the wheel.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: SO, what exactly are we talking about here? A little peeker, or did the prairie dog actually come out to play?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Are we talking explosive?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: The haemacel was negative for blood, and I wouldn't say he actually exploded. More like... gushed?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good, now we're getting somewhere

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah? Where?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I have no idea Hello?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Of course! The riddles.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hi mom! Look, err, I have a business dinner on Thursday night, I can't get out of it. I know, I really I wanted to see you too. Uhh, actually, can I call you back? I'm in a meeting right now. Okay, thanks.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Who was that?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Angelina Jolie. I call her mom. Who thinks that's sexy? So, explosive or gushing...

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: She never calls you, is everything okay?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Great, yeah. My dad's taking her to Europe, they got a nine-hour layover in Newark on Thursday. If it's gastrointestinal...

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You lied to avoid seeing your own mom.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Are you kidding? I can't lie to my mom. Seriously, I can't! Wilson's invited me to dinner. It'd be rude to stand up a guy who just loaned me 5 grand.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Transverse myelitis. Could cause numbness, anal sphincter dysfunction, and the shocks.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thank you for taking no interest in my mother. But that begs the question, what caused the transverse myelitis?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Well, we've ruled out cancer and MS, leaves infection

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: If there's infection there'd be a fever

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And his blood and CSF cultures are all negative

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Maybe the infection's gone but the memory remains

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Molecular mimicry. Nice. Okay, get an immunoglobulin level and an electrophoresis

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're good my friend, I'm sure we'll meet again.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You really think that was his mom on the phone?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Probably. Don't know why he'd lie about that.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Who cares?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You're not the least bit curious what his parents are like?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'm sure his mom's a piece of work! Only a mother could do that much damage.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: My bet's he was born the way he is. Probably tormented his parents, not the other way around

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah he was either a fast runner or one hell of a fighter. Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You guys can handle the tests, right?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Is there something important that you and House need to discuss over dinner?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Other than the sky-rocketing interest rates on personal loans? You know this is the fourth time I've loaned him money? Not lunch money. Money money.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: House's parents... they have a layover in Newark Thursday evening.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm cancelling dinner

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: No. Thought maybe you could just invite a few more people.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: An infectious agent's molecular structure can resemble the spinal cord's. When the immune system attacks the infection, it ends up attacking the spinal cords as well.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: So he has an infection?

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: Just said I don't

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If the infection is gone, it goes right on attacking because the spinal cord is still there

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: Is there a treatment?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Depends on what the original infection was. All right, you're done. You need to lay flat after a lumbar puncture for about an hour.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: I feel like I'm going to throw up. Hey dad, can you uh, can you get me a coke please?

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: Yeah, that usually helps

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're done

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If you're nauseous

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: No, I'm not nauseous, I just wanted him out of here

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He's your dad, he's going to be around

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: Yeah, I know. It's not that it's...

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Are these people completely incapable of telling the truth to each other?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He went to Jamaica with his friends.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No wonder he lied. Children aren't supposed to have good times.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: One of his friends flew them down. Carnell's dad has this thing about him accepting stuff from rich friends. Wants him to remember who he is, where he came from.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Where have you been?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Making dinner plans. What's up?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The boys have uncovered the shocking fact that the patient has a crappy relationship with his dad.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: They seem to actually care

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well I don't. There's only one reason any kid with a plane flies to Jamaica.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It wasn't for marijuana. He doesn't do anything but drink

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He say that to you or his pops?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Tox screen was negative for THC

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Spring break was over a month ago, even pot would have washed out by now

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Even if he'd smoked, no way marijuana causes transverse myelitis

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: True. But the stuff they put on it does.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Pesticides.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Why would he come clean about the trip but lie about smoking pot?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Well you wouldn't necessarily have to smoke to get pesticide poisoning. He could have eaten fruit that had been sprayed or been exposed to his skin on a hike.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or he could have smoked it. A lot of it. And then lied about it because that's what this family does. Start him on IV of pralidoxime. 2 grams per litre and then 1 gram every eight hours until you see some improvement.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You have no evidence to support a poisoning diagnosis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Which is why it's going to be so cool when I turn out to be right.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cameron, who were you making dinner plans with?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: No one.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You bastard! You invited my parents to dinner.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Geez Cameron's got a big mouth!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hah! Not as big as yours!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hey! You used me to avoid seeing your parents.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well what do you care?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I don't, I just thought it might be interesting to find out why.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You could have just asked.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You would have lied!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And you would have believed me! Which would have kept us both happy. You want your money back? Is this what this is about?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No! Wait, what... have you got the money?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: If you have the money then why did you need the loan?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I didn't. Just wanted to see if you could give it to me. I've been borrowing increasing amounts ever since you lent me 40 dollars a year ago. A little experiment to see where you draw the line.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're you're trying to... objectively measure how much I value our friendship?!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey, it's 5 grand. You've got nothing to be ashamed of. So what do you say? One little phone call and one big cheque?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Fine. Thanks. Now, be a grown-up and either tell mommy and daddy you don't want to see them, or I'm picking you up at 7 for dinner

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What do you mean? You just said that--

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I lied. I've been lying to you in increasing amounts ever since I told you you looked good unshaved, a year ago. It's a little experiment, you know, see where you draw the line

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: How's the patient?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Haven't been in yet today.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: As long as he hasn't gotten any worse. We're treating him for pesticide poisoning without any proof it was pesticides. I'm going to have hell of a time explaining that to our lawyer.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I told House not to--

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Wow!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Lawyer's not going to believe this.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: He's got his appetite back! Whatever you did is working.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's healthy, so all is forgiven. Now I'm feeling nauseous.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: He is not healthy. Nausea and diarrhoea were not his only symptoms!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The shocks have also decreased

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: But not disappeared.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And he's out of the diaper, which is good news for everyone.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What about his low white count?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The little buggers need time to grow. Don't worry, our wrestling Rastafarian will be back on his feet and sneaking around behind pap's back again in no time. Yeah. Check it again. I'll be right there.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Apparently I can save money by switching to another long-distance carrier.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Oh I was right, wasn't I?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh yeah, it's always about you isn't it?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He has the chills and his temperature's spiking. It's nearly 106

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: What's that mean? I mean... what's happening?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You want the truth? Or you want me to make something up to protect you? We think a drunk driver broke into his room.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: What's happening to my son!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The truth is... I have no idea.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There's the fever that Cameron was looking for

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We knew if it was myelitis there had to be an "itis". This must be the infection that set it off.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, except in this universe, effect follows cause. I've complained about it, but--

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Maybe the tests were wrong

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, the tests were right. Yesterday he had no fever, no infection.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So he just happened to catch a bug while he was here? That's all this is?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. Because his white blood cell count was down he was vulnerable, because it's really down it might kill him. That's ALL this is. Is he still pooping his pants?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He just started again.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Again?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It stopped when he was getting better.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He was feeling better, he was never getting better.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So, all we have to answer is what causes a 22-year-old kid to become immuno-compromised with GI involvement AND shocks.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And to stop and start for no apparent reason.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: And we need to find an answer before this infection kills him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That would be the ideal. You intravenous broad spectrum antibiotics. You get a cervical thoracic and lumbar T2-weighted fast spin echo MRIs, and you track down all those Richie Riches who went to Jamaica. See if any of them have got the shocks, the trots or the hots. Hots is the... fever

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You guys going to join us for dinner Thursday?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Umm... got to do my laundry.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You're not curious?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm curious about crocs but I don't stick my head in their mouths

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'm out too. What? House is a freak! There's no virus that causes that, no DNA mutation. You're going to have one dinner with two people, sixty minutes. Most of it spent chewing and talking about the weather. Unless they say something like "do you prefer the chardonnay or the merlot? And oh, we kept Greg locked in the closet for 17 years" , you're not going to learn anything.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We'd like to talk to some of your friends, see if they have any similar symptoms

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: The doctors in the ER already asked me that.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We understand, but they didn't have all the information that we have now.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: What kind of information?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Would you mind if I spoke with Carnell alone for a minute?

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: Is this bad news?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: No. It's just confidential.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: Why is something suddenly confidential? I mean, if you know something about my son, I need to know what's going on.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I'm sorry, I have to insist.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: I'm his father. And if I'm going to take care of him, I need to know the truth.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: Dad... she wants to know who I went to Jamaica with.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: You've never been to Jamaica!

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: Taddy's dad flew a bunch of us down over Spring break.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: You told me you had two papers to write over the break.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: 'Cause I didn't want to come home and work my ass off. I wanted an actual break. Don't want to break for once. I shouldn't have lied to you.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: No, what you should have done is come home instead of partying with your rich friends.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I'm sorry, we need those names.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What do you want?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: To apologise. I realise that my attention to the clinic has been somewhat lax of late and I want to make amends. How about tomorrow night, I take the night shift?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: The clinic's closed at night

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah but I'm sure there's plenty of things to be done, there's charts to be reviewed, supplies inventoried--

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Dinners avoided?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're going too?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I love their Cobb salad.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Give me a reason to get out of this, and I'll tell you who started the rumour about you being a transsexual.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: There is no such rumour.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There will be, unless you get me out of this dinner.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No one's making you do this, House, just do what everybody else does, lie to them.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You lie to your mother?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Only since I was twelve!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: My mom's a human polygraph. My dad should be taking her to Vegas, not the Louvre.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Trust me, your mom would much rather think you have a business meeting than you hate her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't hate her. I hate him.

utterance.speaker: Taddy
utterance.content: We all had headaches, nausea, vomiting. You know, we figured it was connected to the massive amounts of drinking. What, you think what happened to Carnell had something to do with the trip?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Don't know, you haven't had any unexplained pain or strange feelings since you got back?

utterance.speaker: Taddy
utterance.content: Nope, except for a little Athlete's foot I'm fine.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Can I see it?

utterance.speaker: Taddy
utterance.content: See what?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Your feet. There's a common parasite in Jamaica that can resemble foot fungus.

utterance.speaker: Taddy
utterance.content: It's not really my feet. You know, I figured fungus is fungus. It's my groin.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I'm going to need to take a look at that.

utterance.speaker: Taddy
utterance.content: Now?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Unless you want to come down to the hospital with me.

utterance.speaker: Taddy
utterance.content: No, no, I can't. I mean, I just started two days ago, we're right in the middle of a big mer--

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Then drop your pants.

utterance.speaker: Older guy
utterance.content: Riley I need the-- What the hell's going on here?

utterance.speaker: Taddy
utterance.content: She's a doctor!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I'm a doctor, he has a rash and a friend of his is--

utterance.speaker: Older guy
utterance.content: Right, well, as soon as she's done treating your rash, I need the numbers on deport technology.

utterance.speaker: Taddy
utterance.content: Yes sir.

utterance.speaker: Older guy
utterance.content: And err... doctor why don't you leave a card on your way out?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Except for one guy with a rash, no one else on the trip has any health issues.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What kind of rash?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I don't know. I took some scrapings, it doesn't appear to be ringworm.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What did it look like? Aside from not ringworm.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Basically like diaper rash. He's been working around the clock, said he hasn't changed his clothes in three days.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Kaposi's sarcoma could look like diaper rash.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Any discolouration around the edges?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Get him in here, we all want to take a look.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Even if it is Kaposi's it's not related. Our patient doesn't have any skin symptoms and we've already ruled out cancer.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What are the odds of two friends who've just returned from a trip outside the country coming down with unexplained, but unrelated illnesses? Get him in here.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He won't come. Just started a new job after graduation, they're working on some big merger.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Tell him his friend's life hangs in the balance.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: That's what I told him the first time. Still wound up driving into Manhattan.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Tell him his life hangs in the balance. Tell him the rash is flesh-eating and the next course in the menu is his frank and beans.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Where's Stacy?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Err... speaking at a Conference in Baltimore, why what do you need?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Can I ask an opinion on a patient? House wants me to lie to the kid to get him in here.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Well then you'll be the one getting the subpoena.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Well we do need to diagnosis his friend.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Take the test to the kid.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: There is no test, House just wants to look at it.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Then take House to "it".

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Yeah, like that's going to happen.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Tell House his parents called. Said they were coming in early. He'll go anywhere just to avoid them

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: So it's ok to lie to House but not to a patient.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Yep!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What's wrong?

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: His stomach's getting a lot worse

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's rigid! He's bleeding into his abdomen.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: What's going on?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We need a surgeon and an OR, stat!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: On it!

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: Try to hang in there, Carnell

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The infection caused a perforation in his sigmoid colon. It's repairable.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: But it means the antibiotics aren't working.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Double the dose. And add tygacil to the list.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Soon as he's out of surgery.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Where's Richie Rich?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He said he can't leave work.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, you told me that two hours ago.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I'm not going to lie.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why, 'cause it's wrong? Or because you're a coward?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Hmm, tough choice.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You've been wasting 2 hours of the kid's time. Is that deeply and unforgivably morally wrong? No. Because it's not a waste of his time. Unless we're wrong, unless his condition has got nothing to do with his friend's. You're just afraid of being wrong.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Your parents called. They had to catch an earli--

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You don't have to lie to him, kid's on his way here.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He got off work?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Yeah, by vomiting blood. Ambulance is 10 minutes out.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You Taddy?

utterance.speaker: Taddy
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Love the name. If I ever have a dog... take off his pants.

utterance.speaker: Taddy
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don't talk to her, listen to me

utterance.speaker: Paramedic
utterance.content: He's vomited in excess of 3 units of blood, he needs to be admitted before--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You wanted to be a doctor, maybe you should have buckled down a little more in high school

utterance.speaker: Paramedic
utterance.content: Bite me.

utterance.speaker: Taddy
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Exactly how close were you and Carnell?

utterance.speaker: Taddy
utterance.content: Not so close.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Spend a lot of time together in Jamaica? Share a room?

utterance.speaker: Taddy
utterance.content: Wait, you don't think... look, we're not gay.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not saying you're gay, I'm saying you had sex.

utterance.speaker: Taddy
utterance.content: Look we're not gay, we hardly even hung out.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Right, so you just flew him down to Jamaica because he won a contest.

utterance.speaker: Taddy
utterance.content: No he's in my frat, all right? Between school and wrestling, and going home every break to work in his father's junkyard, Carnell didn't have any time to hang out with anybody.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not fungus.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I already told you that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There's no pustules, it's not Staph... His dad's what?

utterance.speaker: Taddy
utterance.content: His dad owns a scrap metal salvage yard. Carnell worked there during breaks.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You lied.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, problems with this family, probably need more specifics. You told us you owned a construction company, not a salvage yard.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: I know the way things work, the better my job, the better my son gets treated.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Right. That's why I'm mad. 'Cause we wasted all that filet mignon on you. Did your kid find anything unusual the last time he worked for you?

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Braided wire, metal weights, lead canister, maybe just a lid. Probably used it as a door stop or paperweight.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: Why would he want to--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay, here it comes

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: I gave him an early graduation gift, old plumb I found. Looks like a fishing weight. Put it on a keychain so he'd always remember where he came from.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So he can lie about it later. Where's the keychain?

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: I don't know. He never used it, just kept it as a good luck charm.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Kept it where?

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: I don't know! Why? Why does it matter?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Where are the kid's clothes?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: In the bureau back in his regular room?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You two get it to radiology.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: His clothes?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The bureau. Don't open it. You come with me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Set it down there. Now get out of here, this thing is radioactive.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The chances of radiation causing CNS symptoms?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Whoa.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Call the boys in the lead pyjamas.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The measurements weren't high enough to cause Central Nervous System damage.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It might not have caused nerve damage, but it definitely destroyed his immune system.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And caused tumours.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We don't know that. None of the MRIs showed anything.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do a PET scan. Check his cervical spine. It's not going to be good news.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Mr Hall... it's not good news.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The piece of metal that you gave Carnell was from an industrial device used to test welds. People aren't supposed to just dump radioactive material...

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: But they do. So what now? I mean, what do you do?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Anyone who's had contact with the source will have to immediately get treatment for radiation sickness. Taddy carried it on his lap on the flight--

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: So there is a treatment?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Transfusions. And then we try to get the fluids and electrolytes balanced. Carnell... he's had much more exposure. The equivalent of about 70,000 chest X-rays. His ability to create white blood cells has been completely destroyed.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: That's why he... he... can't fight off this infection?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He's going to need a bone marrow transplant. And we did a... we did another PET scan. There's a cavernous angioma within his spinal cord, it's a tumour. That's what’s been causing the shocks and CNS symptoms.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: He has a tumour inside of his spinal cord?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah. The cord is... is made of strands put together. Sort of like a kite string. The surgeon should be able to pull the strands apart and excise the tumour, but surgery on someone who is as hemopoetically compromised as your son is... it's extremely risky.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: And uh... if you don't do this surgery... I mean...

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The tumour could cause his breathing to stop. Possibly his heart as well. There's no way you could have known. You're going to have to come with us, you need to start treatment yourself.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: No, no no no, I can start my treatment later...

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: But he can't. He needs to be in a sterile isolation room to prevent further infections.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Mom.

utterance.speaker: Mom
utterance.content: We're early.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's great to see you.

utterance.speaker: Mom
utterance.content: Oh Greg, don't lie.

utterance.speaker: Mom
utterance.content: We came at a bad time, didn't we?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Actually, yeah. I uh... I have to take a rain check.

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: Aww, plans have been made. Wilson made 'em.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I asked him to cancel. I'm dealing with kind of a complicated case right now, so...

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: Well, we'll just come back when things aren't so out of control.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: My team is busy.

utterance.speaker: Mom
utterance.content: You don't want to see us?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Mom, don't make me feel guilty.

utterance.speaker: Mom
utterance.content: No no, of course not! Sorry.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I've got a patient who's probably going to die of radiation poisoning.

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: So that means you can't eat? Come on, let's grab a bite in the cafeteria.

utterance.speaker: Mom
utterance.content: I'll buy you a ruben.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well I guess I've got time for a sandwich.

utterance.speaker: Mom
utterance.content: Good!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I just wanted to let you know that Carnell's prepped for surgery.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Hi, I'm Allison Cameron. I work with your son.

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: Greg's told us all about you.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: New, huh?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nope. Just gullible.

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: I'm sorry, I was just making fun of my son, not of you.

utterance.speaker: Mom
utterance.content: We're just about to go get something to eat, would you care to join us?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You don't have a lot of time with your son. Maybe another time.

utterance.speaker: Surgeon
utterance.content: Do you like the Beatles?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: They're all right.

utterance.speaker: Surgeon
utterance.content: My 12-year-old just turned me back on to them. McCartney's got to have more money than God.

utterance.speaker: Surgeon
utterance.content: Think that's all of it. Reverse him. How's he doing?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Looks pretty good down here.

utterance.speaker: Surgeon
utterance.content: Do I rock or what?

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: His pressure's dropping!

utterance.speaker: Surgeon
utterance.content: Give him another two units.

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: I did already!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: His heart rate's falling, he's haemorrhaging.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: They're talking about mom's last trip to the dentist. Grown children talking to their parents, nothing gets talked about. Trust me, you're not missing anything.

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: So, besides work, what you been up to?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not much.

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: You always say that. Not much.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's always the answer.

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: Any new babes you might want to tell me about?

utterance.speaker: Mom
utterance.content: Leave him alone, John.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Got a new motorcycle. Might have seen it out front, it's orange with a gigantic scrape.

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: Is it the one in the handicap parking?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. Looks like crap, but it drives great.

utterance.speaker: Mom
utterance.content: You'll be careful, right?

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: Last I checked, you still have two legs.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Actually, three

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: You know what your problem is, Greg?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Shifting gears?

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: You just don't know how lucky you are.

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: Where's the head?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, good thing we got that cleared up

utterance.speaker: Mom
utterance.content: Oh he was just trying to help.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't need help.

utterance.speaker: Mom
utterance.content: I know. You're absolutely perfect just the way you are.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: Thank you. So how much longer do you think he'll be in surgery?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's hard to say.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: Hmm . You know he just started school when Anne died? I was a mess. Still adjusting to being a parent, much less a single parent. You know I used to put cold pancakes in his lunchbox . I mean, that was the only thing that I could make that he would eat.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You did ok, he's a good kid.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: Hey. So... how is he?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Well, the surgeon has removed the tumour without damaging the spinal cord, but the infection has caused another intestinal perforation. We stopped the bleeding, but his white count keeps falling.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: Okay.. um... so what now? Another drug? Antibiotics? What?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm sorry. The reality is, no matter what we give him, it's unlikely he's going to be able to fight off the infections.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: Okay, okay.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: The father and the friend are responding well to treatment. Things aren't looking so good for Carnell.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thank you. For not eating.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It was none of my business.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: They seem perfectly pleasant don't they? They are. He was a marine pilot. She was a housewife. Married 47 years. They had one child. Mom was just like everyone else, nice enough, no great sense of humour, hates confrontation. My dad's just like you. Not the caring 'til your eyes pop out part, just the insane moral compass that won't let you lie to anybody about anything. It's a great quality for boy scouts and police witnesses. Crappy quality for a dad.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: Hey, how're you doing?

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: I'm hanging in there.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: I'm sorry I lied to you about mom.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: I'm sorry I lied to you too.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: There was nothing good that came out of her dying.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: I'm not mad. I know why you did it, it worked. I never drink and drive.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: I'm scared, dad.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: Come on, there's nothing to be scared of. You're going to be just fine.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: Don't play me. I want to know the truth.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: I'm telling you the truth. You're going to be fine. I swear.

utterance.speaker: Carnell
utterance.content: I love you, dad.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: I love you too.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Why does he hate seeing his parents? So his dad tells the truth, he can't handle that?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He hates being a disappointment.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He's a doctor, world famous! How disappointed can they be?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You know what I figure is worse than watching your son become crippled? Watching him be miserable.
